subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}

{{Han compound|爪|卩|ls=ic|t1=claw; hand|t2=kneeling person}} – complexion.

''{{w|Shuowen}}'' interprets this character as an {{Han compound|人|卩|ls=ic|t1=person; human|t2=etiquette|nocap=1}} – complexion.

Compare {{zh-l|*印}}, {{zh-l|*抑}}.

subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Etymology 1
Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|いろ}}

# [[color]] (US), [[colour]] (UK)
#: {{ja-usex|目の'''色'''が違う猫|め の '''いろ''' が ちがう ねこ|a cat that has eyes of different '''color'''}}
# the metaphorical color or [[mood]]
## one's [[facial]] [[coloring]] or [[expression]]
## the [[shape]] of one's [[face]] or [[appearance]]; more specifically, beautiful [[looks]] or a beautiful [[figure]]
## [[lively]] [[elegance]], [[enjoyable]] or [[interesting]] [[charm]]
## apparent [[thoughtfulness]], [[warmheartedness]]
## the [[feeling]] or [[mood]] of a thing
## the [[tenor]] or [[timber]] of a [[voice]] or [[sound]]
## in [[Noh]], a section that is [[chant]]ed at a medium pace; alternately, a [[decorative]] [[poetic]] section
## in {{m|ja|浄瑠璃|tr=jōruri||puppet show narrative}}, a [[lively]] section that is neither strictly [[dialog]] nor [[narration]], but has many elements of dialog
## when playing the [[koto]], pushing on a string with the fingers of the left hand to change the [[pitch]] of a [[note]], or for [[vibrato]]
# something related to [[romantic]] or [[sexual]] [[love]], particularly between genders
## the [[emotion]]s or [[circumstance]]s of [[attraction]] between [[gender]]s
## [[extramarital]] [[relation]]s, an [[affair]]
## an [[extramarital]] [[lover]]
## a [[prostitute]]
## a [[red-light district]]
# the [[type]] or [[kind]] of something
# {{lb|ja|sort=いろ|informal|slang}} various specific kinds of [[color]]:
## {{lb|ja|sort=いろ|informal|slang|woman's word}} [[lipstick]] or [[rouge]]
## {{lb|ja|sort=いろ|informal|slang}} [[soy sauce]]
## {{lb|ja|sort=いろ|informal|slang}} [[paint]]

subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|しょく|yomi=o}}
From {{bor|ja|ltc|-}} {{ltc-l|色}}. The ''{{ll|ja|漢音|''kan'on''}}'' reading, so likely a later borrowing.<ref name="KDJ"/>
